case_vignette: A 35-year-old man presents with pain in his feet during exercise and at rest. He says that his fingers and toes become pale upon exposure to cold temperatures. He has an extensive smoking history, but no history of diabetes mellitus nor hyperlipidemia. He used to exercise frequently but has stopped because of the symptoms. On inspection, a tiny ulcer is found on his toe. On laboratory analysis, his blood sugar, blood pressure, and lipids are all within the normal range.
question: Which is the most probable diagnosis?
